alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Nelson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 5:03AM EST until January 04 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rolling Fork River near Boston affecting Hardin and Nelson Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 24 hours has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rolling Fork River near Boston. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Agricultural bottomland is covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 33.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 35.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.8 feet on 11/08/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
